H0.text: Proteins are the main product of the cell made in ribosomes, the non‑membrane bound organelles present in both eukaryotes and prokaryotes.

H1.text: Lipids are the main product of the cell that is made in the non‑membrane bound organelles called ribosomes in both eukaryotes and prokaryotes.

H2.text: Protons are the main product of the cell made in ribosomes, which are non‑membrane bound organelles found in both eukaryotes and prokaryotes.

H3.text: Sugars are the main product of the cell that is made in the non‑membrane bound organelles called ribosomes in both eukaryotes and prokaryotes.

A4.text: Ribosomes link amino acids together in the order specified by the codons of messenger RNA molecules to form polypeptide chains.

A5.text: Ribosomes are found within all cells and are sometimes described as 'non-membranous organelles'.
